console.log("New Contract Message:", await newContract.getMessage());
newContract = await Factory.attach("0x1D2714d4c5fb92b0f5ee1FB35d694EB8856bAa6c");
console.log("New Contract Message:", await newContract.getMessage());
const newContract = await Factory.attach(NEW_ADDRESS);
console.log("New Contract Message:", await newContract.getMessage());
// The new contract returns its current (modified) state
console.log("Old Contract Message:", await oldContract.getMessage()); 
// The old contract returns its original state
const newContract = await Factory.attach(NEW_ADDRESS); 
// Attach to the new, writable version
const oldContract = await Factory.attach(OLD_ADDRESS); 
// Attach to the old, read-only version
const Factory = await ethers.getContractFactory("HelloWorld");
const NEW_ADDRESS = "0x...TheNewOne..."; 
// Paste the NEW contract address here
const OLD_ADDRESS = "0x41C1a9A24dC71e5961663576C19cf3089ce420a0"; 
// Paste the OLD contract address here
console.log("Current message:", message);
// 5. Print the result
const message = await helloWorld.getMessage();
// 4. Call the read-only function (getMessage)
const helloWorld = await HelloWorldFactory.attach(contractAddress);
// 3. Attach the Factory to the deployed contract address
const HelloWorldFactory = await ethers.getContractFactory("HelloWorld");
// 2. Get the ContractFactory object (using the contract name)
const contractAddress = "0x41C1a9A24dC71e5961663576C19cf3089ce420a0";
// 1. Define the address of the deployed contract
